abstract: Students at University of Cape Town in South Africa hold series of protests seeking to ‘decolonize’ school, asking for more black faculty members, policies to increase number of black students and curriculum that is more Afro-centric; demonstrations highlight nation's frustration with white South Africans holding disproportionate amount of power and slow pace of granting equal representation to more black South Africans beyond small contingent of politically connected elite.
lead_paragraph: Protests at the University of Cape Town and other campuses have exposed broader anger over policies that are believed to have mostly benefited a small black elite.

headline.main: Students in South Africa Protest Slow Pace of Change
headline.print_headline: Students in South Africa Protest Slow Pace of Change

snippet: Protests at the University of Cape Town and other campuses have exposed broader anger over policies that are believed to have mostly benefited a small black elite.
